intro: Lepidium ruderale var. alpigenum, commonly known as alpine peppergrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, often lobed leaves. This annual or biennial species typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in rocky and well-drained soils. Its morphology includes a low-growing habit with branched stems and small, capsule-like fruits. The plant is adapted to cold climates and is often found in mountainous areas of Europe and Asia.
